title: Jimmy Price
text:
James Price (born 1960) is a retired British <a href="boxing">boxer</a>.
Boxing career.
He represented <a href="England%20at%20the%201982%20Commonwealth%20Games">England</a> and won a <a href="gold%20medal">gold medal</a> in the 75 kg middleweight division, at the <a href="1982%20Commonwealth%20Games">1982 Commonwealth Games</a> in <a href="Brisbane">Brisbane</a>, <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>, <a href="Australia">Australia</a>.
Price was a southpaw and boxed for the Holy Name ABC in Fazakerley. He was the <a href="England%20Boxing%20National%20Amateur%20Championships%20Light-Middleweight%20Champions">ABA light-middleweight champion</a> in 1980 and the <a href="England%20Boxing%20National%20Amateur%20Championships%20Middleweight%20Champions">ABA middleweight champion</a> in 1982.
He turned professional on 3 February 1983 and fought in 19 fights.
